definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)

sentences.english: School curriculum should be reasonable, do students work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 學校應該合理地課改，做到讓學生勞逸結合。

sentences.english: Athletes understand that effective training comes from a combination of exercise and rest.
sentences.chinese: 運動員明白有效的訓練要勞逸結合。

sentences.english: They may actually get more toil out of you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，勞逸結合也許會讓你更加辛苦。

sentences.english: Only through reconciling work and rest can we improve efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 勞逸結合才能提高工作效率。

sentences.english: Has the time amusement, although said alternates work with rest, but works in where?
sentences.chinese: 有時間玩樂，雖然說勞逸結合，但是勞動在何處？

sentences.english: Next, must avoid overtiredly, the attention alternates work with rest.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要避免過度疲勞，注意勞逸結合。

sentences.english: Our today's terms, is the meaning of combining exertion and rest.
sentences.chinese: 拿我們今天的話來說，就是勞逸結合的意思。

sentences.english: Note physical exercise, combining exertion, to take part in physical activities.
sentences.chinese: 注意鍛鍊身體，勞逸結合，多參加體育活動。

sentences.english: To keep healthy, every one of us should work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保持健康，我們每個人都應勞逸結合。
